Today January 31, 2019 at 1am my wife's and my car car were ticketed by the City of Boston under code 316 Sidewalk. We had been parking for many years facing the house on my property, perpendicular to the front wall of the house as far as possible and the cars overlap few inches of the sidewalk/driveway ramp from the street. There are many properties for blocks on this neighborhood that uses the same way to park their cars in front of the houses. Talking to my next door neighbors, they also got tickets on their cars.
We hope that the City can look into this situation for which the residents do not have other options regarding this parking issue considering that off the street parking is not feasible due to the fact that Poplar street in these area is very busy with buses, emergencies vehicles, and regular traffic, not to mention that is designated as an "emergency artery" during snow storms.
Hoping that the City can resolve this issue favorable for the many residents. Thank you

At the time of this report, there are three cars sitting in the bike lane with their blinkers going. This report isn't a request for enforcement (which is why I am not labeling it "illegal Parking"), is a request to fix the bike lane. As is, this bike lane is unusable because it is an open invitation to drivers to use it to pull over. This isn't a bike lane, it's a temporary parking lane, where anyone on a bicycle is expected to merge into fast (and impatient) traffic. I have been personally threatened by drivers (including an armored van driver!) for asking them not to park here. "I'm just going to be a minute." "Why don't you just go around." "No one is going to ticket me here." "F*#k off, mind your own business." Don't close this ticket and say "area clear". Fix this lane before another BU student is killed just trying to get around the Boston metro area. The longer you leave this, the more drivers will feel that they have every right to park here. I would like to be able to commute home without worrying whether I'll make it alive. Is avoiding flex posts here for plowing and delivery reasons worth my life?

description: Multiple trucks (utility and construction) parked in the street for up to eight hours at a time with engines running despite there being no need to complete work (not operating vehicles such as excavators or generators). There is a city regulation limiting idling to 5 mins if the truck is actively engaged in work. We are fine with the trucks having to be present for work, but nit with needless idling polluting the air and putting our children's' health at risk. We request enforcement of this regulation and hopefully paying if it in the area as we are looking at nearly one month if construction due to gas work and other construction activities.

status_notes: Case Resolved. VAULT. Dear Constituent,. . The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) Inspector has identified that vault on the sidewalk needing attention as the responsibility of Ever source Electric. . Replacing or repairing vaults is not an easy repair. . Ever source has to have the vaults custom made for each separate location. . This takes time.  In addition the construction itself is technical and involved, as well as expensive. . We have informed Ever source Electric that they have to set aside resources to repair vaults around the City. . The estimated time for replacement is 6-9 months. . However, we will require Ever source to make a temporary repair such as the use of asphalt, especially if it is a major tripping hazard. . The temporary repair should be done within 3 business days. . For any questions or concern, please contact the number listed below. . Sincerely,. . Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.

description:
Hello, 

I am reaching out regarding the parking lot on Seaport Blvd, across from Shake Shake and on the opposite corner of Warby Parker.

The outside edge of this parking lot, nearest Seaport Blvd, is very unkept. This is the spot where the Cisco Brewery and the Christmas tree stand were. After the closure of these pop-ups, the area was left in complete dismay. For example, there is mangled up carpet left from the brewery, along with left behind dead Christmas trees.

It is surprising that Seaport, notably one of the most innovative neighborhoods that cares so deeply about the area's prosperity, has a sort of junk yard on display right in the middle of it.

All this said, the goal of this message is to bring the issue to attention and find a resolution for cleaning-up this eyesore, which is taking away from the value and beauty of the neighborhood. 

Are you able to put me in contact with someone who can help address this? Alternatively, let me know if you are able to help address this issue yourself.

Thank you in advance.

description: The heater in my apartment doesn't work at all, and it's been like this for two months, which is Apt 9. I have been calling the building building management to fix it. They have never sent anyone to fix it. I am getting frustrated, and it is freezing in the room. Additionally, the lock is extremely hard to lock and unlock, and the windows leak as well. Please help me. Thank you in advance.

I'd like to file a noise complaint against Wonder Bar. Almost every night since I moved to this apartment in September I can hear the music from the club, sometimes as early as 7pm and as late as 2am. Often, particularly Thursday-Saturday, it's loud enough to shake my windows or for me to hear lyrics from my apartment. There's no reason for any establishment to play music at that volume, and if they do find it necessary then they should soundproof the building. There are 3 other people in my apartment and many other people in this building who are all inconvenienced by Wonder Bar's noise pollution. I have tried to contact Wonder Bar multiple times but have not been contacted back.

status_notes: Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. National Grid responding to a gas leak on your street activated an emergency permit. Emergency work must be performed no matter what time of day or night in the interest of public safety and the protection of private property. This proved to be a very difficult repair, resulting in National Grid working into the night. The job is now completed. National Grid always calls for a police detail. However unfortunately sometimes the details are not filled. The city apologizes for the inconvenience this necessary work caused. If you want to discuss this matter further, please don't hesitate to contact the number listed below. . Sincerely,. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.
